Interview Questions: Describe a situation that you had to handle multiple priorities simultaneously. How did you handle it?

title: Business Development Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply on ASU's website, get a email interview notice, interviewed by 3 managers with professional dress.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time with tools

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, straight forward. I was asked about my experience and how it relates to the job. I was asked if I get along well with people and have patience for students who ask me for help. I was asked why I want the job. This was for the Digital Culture department, it was my field of study and I was able to answer all the questions easily.
Interview Questions: You have all of this experience, do you think this job will keep your interest?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Arizona State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process varies between each department and sometimes the departments may have a hire in mind already. The key to getting a job at ASU is to make your resume have the phrases and words that are in the Job Description in YOUR resume and cover letter. outline exactly how your experience compares to the required/preferred and how your degree aligns. They also want to know that you are intending on furthering your education, especially if you only have a bachelors degrees. They want to see that you can grow as well.
Interview Questions: It's not difficult but be able to speak how you can adapt to rapid change.

title: Systems Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: An interview with 4 people on technical issues in AV and computer support. Luckily I had worked at several places on campus to learn all about AV and computer support.
Interview Questions: A ton of AV questions - IE: How do you setup a video conference?

title: Library Mail Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a job request form in person in library on campus with job code from student job board.  Application not available anywhere online or at any other location. Asked about prior shipping and receiving experience, course load, availability of transport and other student commitments in a phone interview, one week later.  One week after that, called back for in-person interview which included professionalism related and customer service questions.
Interview Questions: What prior experience do you have with the US Postal Service and other shipping entities like FedEx or UPS?

title: Customer Service Specialist Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of four interviewers. They rotated asking questions. There were approximately twelve questions in the interview.  It lasted close to an hour.  Toward the end of the interview I had the opportunity to ask any questions I had.
Interview Questions: Can you describe your experience in customer service?

title: Career Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University
Interview Descriptions: Turn in your resume at the beginning of the school semester and they automatically call you a couple days after if they are interested. You get an interview within days.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were not that difficult and it actually depends on the professor. Processing time is 1 -2 week. Again, it depends on the professor. If a professor badly needs you then you will be hired immediately otherwise you will have to work without pay for a semester and then funding will be given.
Interview Questions: Nothing was difficult

title: Coordinator, Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I first did a phone interview. For this particular department (this was my second department at ASU), I soon learned I was first interviewed by the Associate Vice Provost at the time. The second interview was given by the Directors and then followed with a third interview with the directors and other coordinators. I was asked to complete an event plan, which I had to present at the final interview to demonstrate my knowledge of the role.
Interview Questions: Unfortunately I can't remember the interview questions at this time. It's been 3 years.

title: UTO Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Mesa, AZ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It very formal interview process . With 2 interviewers and a lot of technical questions. They interviewed me on all aspects of my tech knowledge .   They will make it clear in the interview if you are selected or not
Interview Questions: What is level of expertise of windows or Mac troubleshooting

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Arizona State University
Interview Descriptions:
questions regarding your background, resume.
Nothing particularly difficult.
Why interested in this research?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I received a phone call indicating I was selected for an interview.  The interview was scheduled via email.  I only had one interview and it was a group interview via Skype.  I was also offered to speak to the hiring manager via phone in order to get a better idea for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had do deal with a difficult customer.

title: Account Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application. Gave in person interview. Got selected.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very interesting puzzles as to how would you design s/w website. They made me write on paper the basic code and asked to write the test cases for the same. Automation is a very big  service they need now.
Interview Questions: Design and test a webpage

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Mesa, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy interview process. Make sure you call back for an interview. Questions are simple. They are just looking for someone to hire and some don't stay long. Just make sure to be persistent for the position and bring something that makes you preferable as a student worker.
Interview Questions: If you had a problem that you did not know how to solve, how would you solve it?

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
applied through asu part time portal
got email to schedule interview
one to one interview in the office with the hiring manager
got a call and mail for selection next week
easy interview process and quick.
Enough information regarding job role was given at the time of interview.
Interview Questions:
mostly from resume and past experience
describe the object in the room
explain a concept to a new person

title: Agile Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University
Interview Descriptions: Excellent communication from the hiring committe.  It was concise and information laden.
Interview Questions: The usual, "Why are you looking to change employeers" is always a challenge between sharing meaningful information and not appearing too negative toward your former employer,

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Mesa, AZ) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Generous travel expenses for an out-of-town visit.  Staff were very hospitable and lavish with details about the position and living in Tempe.
Interview Questions: Nearly all questions were standard

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Showed interest online. Then I had a current member recommending me for the job. Next I was interviewed and was asked very fair questions and then got the job and was referred to the HR.
Interview Questions: What do you think about this course?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted an online application, I received an email asking me to come in for an interview. The interview was short and a major portion of it was behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest mistake so far?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: an email with the prof, and good GRe score that is all it takes to get the research assistanship position . Personal statement didnt really matter, i had to spend several days what a waste of time
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, two face to face interviews.  One with direct manager and other with direct manager and other staff members within the unit.  It takes them a while to go through the process.  Everyone I have spoken with talks about how long it takes for the interview process at the Arizona State University.
Interview Questions: Didn't have a difficult question, just come prepared to talk about your experiences and how it can help the department you have applied for.  Be prepared to give problem solving examples.

title: Prokurist / Mitglied der Geschäftsleitung Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University
Interview Descriptions:
Pre-interview dinner with three librarians. Very nice people.
Interview with a search committee and then gave a presentation.
Then met colleagues and deans of the school library.
Interview Questions: Mostly are very typical questions

title: Systems Analyst Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first is a phone call to ask you about skills and other general questions. The second interview consists of general questions about your current job duties, skills, and knowledge of what they are looking for. All questions are pretty standard general questions and hypothetical. Real work examples on how you would handle certain situations. They ask you to apply their questions to past experiences. Interviews take about 45 minutes to 2 hours. Technical examples such as, "How would you start a JavaScript document" or anything like that are not asked.
Interview Questions: There really are not unexpected or difficult questions. Anyone with half a brain can come up with a good answer on the fly.

title: Media Production Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a laid back interview.  I was getting hired for my After Effects experience. So they showed me short video clips that had been made in AE and asked how I would have created them. The rest of the interview was just talking and seeing if my personality would fit in well with the small group of people that worked there at that point.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working in a collaborative environment?

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: My boss called me, asked me about my research experience. I just describe how I will process a project. He also asked me about my recent paper. How do I come up with ideas? Where do I find research tools? After couple days he called again said I ranked the first, if I decided to sign the offer, he will hire me. Then he emailed me the offer.
Interview Questions: How do you conduct your research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by one of the research fellows in the lab. He asked me a few questions on my ongoing research projects. He introduced the work the lab has been doing. Quite comfortable interview. I asked him a few questions, and that's it.
Interview Questions: Introduce your background, and the projects you have been working on.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Meeting first with the faculty of the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry (now school of molecular sciences) and then individual faculty members with research areas of interest to me.  Many students are accepted for rotation schedules; in some cases like mine you may be directly accepted into a lab.
Interview Questions: What techniques for purification and characterization for nucleic acids and proteins do you have experience with?

title: Chinese Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview was done in Chinese. There were a few questions asked about previous teaching/tutoring experience; and then it was a proof reading in Chinese.
Interview Questions: It was not hard if you are a Chinese and you had tutoring/teaching experience previously.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: First round was a phone interview.  It consisted of two individuals from ASU.  It was an uncomfortable interview as there was not much feed back from the interviewers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the ASU student worker portal. Shortly after, I received either an email or a phone call requesting an interview. I attended the interview, and within a couple of days, received a phone call from my interviewer (head of the program) asking my availability. I was flexible, and so she then asked when I could start. I gave a couple of days to confirm my decision, then started the following week or so.
Interview Questions: How would you respond if a drunk resident comes up to the desk?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University
Interview Descriptions: Had to email resume and cover letter to hiring manager
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from other applicants?

title: Ticket Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple entry level sales interview. Basic questions. They asked about any sales history you might have. simple stuff. They called on thew phone following the online application, and then had us in for a round table group discussion.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions in the entire process.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed online at the first round. Then I was invited for a campus visit. The program coordinator and a few professors interviewed me and asked me several questions
Interview Questions: Why choose this school and why this program

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty simple, 30 mins long, some behavioral questions, and questions about how you would do on the job. If you look up the job description and ask help from your CA, you would do just fine.
Interview Questions: What things would you do to engage students?

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, interview with head of personal trainer, run him or her through a prototype workout while answering basic fitness questions.
Interview Questions: What is the best way to test cardiovascular endurance?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was granted an in-person interview via email. It was a fairly straight-forward interview. They asked for strong letters of recommendation. I interviewed with the direct supervisor and was hired on the spot. Overall, it was pretty laid back.
Interview Questions:
Why do you climb mountains? 
Have you ever taught anything to anyone? how did you go about it?

title: Student Worker III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two portions: the first portion was a board interview with 5-6 employees who you may or may not work with. If chosen to advance, the second portion is an individual interview with the supervisor who you would be working with. All the interviewers were extremely friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple tasks and responsibilities?

title: Student Worker IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, had a skype interview because I was out of town, three people interviewed me and asked me questions on various topics.  Entire interview lasted about 30 minutes.  Before the interview they emailed me about when I would be available to come in for an interview.
Interview Questions: Questions about accounting, handling confidential material, and STAR questions.

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Job is posted online. Must fill out the process exactly, if you skip questions, you will be eliminated from the pool. Initial screening call to give some background experience. 

Second interview is a panel interview. The questions have been pre-determined, and the interviewers must stick to those questions. All candidates will receive the same set of questions, which may vary from job to job. An evaluation process takes place, and if decided, and offer if given.
Interview Questions: How would you paginate results in a Oracle result set?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview, I felt real good about it. They asked me all the questions they had on the paper and wrote everything i said down. They were very nice but i try not to look at that because nice doesn't mean you have the job. As of now, I'm waiting on a response and its almost been a week. I'll update if something changes and/or if i get the job
Interview Questions: What is your final goal?

title: Any Postion Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel asking me different questions about me and what I could bring to the table. I didn't have any experience and they asked how I could use my personal or work experiences to help me be and asset to the company.
Interview Questions: What difficult circumstance have I over come and how did I overcome it.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Basic Data Structure and Algorithms, Software design and requirement questions. Previous work experience questions. Human Resource and Technical interview was combined. Interviewer was very polite and gave lots of hints during the interview. Basic questions on arrays, graphs, trees were asked.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Success SI Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (ASU, AZ) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Just an in-person 30 conversation with the SI Coordinator. Very informal. We had a conversation about pedagogy, teaching styles, thoughts about leadership and knowledge, and the typical conflict resolution and teamwork based behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Do you think intelligence is genetic or can it be modified?

title: Student Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended by a friend who was a current employee in the same position and knew they would be looking for another student to hire when the current one in this position graduated.  I basically already had the position when I applied for it because the student who recommended me was so highly respected in the office.  They need a responsible student who is serious about his or her goals and studies.
Interview Questions: If you were asked to complete a task you weren't sure how to do, how would you handle the situation?

title: Classified Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: First you submit your resume online with cover letter and references. Then, if they want to move forward they may do a phone screening for candidates. After that, they bring in candidates for in person interviews. If a candidate lives out of state, a skype interview option may be offered. After interviewing a round of candidates, a second round of group interviews may happen. Then, a decision is made for hiring.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for ASU?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a two-step process. First was a phone interview with head of the department and some key faculties. Second interview was at the university and it was a day long which included 1.5 hour of presentation. I talked about my background and prior research work as well as my goals and vision about future research.
Interview Questions: what is your plan for research for next five years at university? (the tenure period is five years and therefore you need to have a clear vision of on what areas you want to focus your research on.

title: ASU Bookstore Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had applied online and also filled out an application form at the bookstore. I was called for interview onsite after more than two months. The interview was for about an hour about working with people and customer service in general. The staff were friendly. It was a part time position at the end of the semester.
Interview Questions: Do you like working with people?

title: Seeking Entry-level Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was interesting.
Interview Questions: What motivates you?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The job was fairly simple. I had to go in the HR and apply. I applied and they emailed me back to set up an interview. After I had set up an interview, they emailed the confirm. I had an interview which was not so much of an interview. They just saw me and said I was hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: FEA Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about mechanic behavior of material. There are some questions from my resume. So it would be helpful to make sure you know everything you put on your resume.
Interview Questions: Hypermesh, Abaqus

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Received an email asking for preferred date for phone interview after one month. I had the phone interview and received the offer. The whole process was easy overall.
Interview Questions: Area of research? prior research experience?

title: Inspector Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Referral or online.. basic interview, mostly regard schedule, flexibility..
Interview Questions: not any

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: 3 people interviewed me and it was about 40 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Ability to use a computer?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview that went well. They were very nice. After about a week, I received a call for an in person interview. I met with two other business analyst and discussed the position and my skills. I then interviewed with two other business analyst and the business manager. All interviews went well and they were very nice. About a month later I received a call from ASU and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: If you could chose to be an animal, which one would it be?

title: Secretary Administrative Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: If they choose your application from their pool of applicants, they will call you and set up an appointment. It really depends on what department you applied to but most offices at ASU have amazing people. The interview was a panel interview with the Director and Assistant Director. I would say be prepared to know about whichever department you interview for and to be positive. Questions included how would you deal with multiple projects given at one time, technical competencies and just your average questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle various projects at one time?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Mesa, AZ) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Typical panel interview, started about 15 min late, most of the panel seemed friendly.  QA started normal, almost every panel member would ask questions then the others would scribble notes.  Then the questions went to the nebulous and undefined.
Interview Questions: What if you had to get some thing done (in a undisclosed foreign country)  but could not because someone was not  allowing?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: A friend refer me for this position, the lab professor of Physics Department interviewed me with a few questions based on resume. Then lead me to the graduate coordinator to give me the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, a week later got a call to set up an interview.  Interview was a panel with three others. Took almost two weeks to get an offer, but was able to start right away.
Interview Questions: Typical questions for the role.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I met with the department head one on one. We discussed what the objective of the department was and the vision for the future. We also discussed specific projects that I would be working on and my responsibilities on those projects. He asked about the projects I had worked on in the past and my interest in education. We talked about some of the existing products that are in the same space as what the department wanted to build and the pros/cons of their implementations.
Interview Questions: I was asked about the previous games I had worked on and what my responsibilities were on those projects.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with assistant to professor and answered standard interview questions including strengths and weaknesses, passions, times a mistake has been made and how fixed etc. A lot of small talk occured which was helpful for me in the process. She said she would get back to me within 2 weeks and did so to offer the job.
Interview Questions: When was a time you made a mistake in your work and how did you fix it?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: My sister worked before me on the same position and she referred me to her boss. I had to fill out an application and received an interview right away as soon as I turned it in (within the same week or so). One of the bosses interviewed me and she asked very general questions regarding my school background (what's your major, etc.). Then she asked me how I would organize tasks if I were given more than one. For example, if there was a line of people waiting to have their questions answered and the phone rang, what would I do? That sort of stuff.
Interview Questions: How would you organize your tasks if you were given more than one? For example, if you were on the desk and there was a line of people waiting for their questions to be answered and the phone rang, what would you do? In what order?

title: Intern for the Outreach Department Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Filled out online application.  About 5 days later scheduled an in person interview.  The in person interview was with one person, the director of the program.  She asked behavior based questions based on the position.  

The interviewer look like she was about 35 years old and was easy to talk to.  This felt like a long interview!  The questions weren't too difficult - just felt like a long interview.  Since it was so long, I think I got a little to comfortable in my speech (since she was easy to talk to), however, I would advise to continue to remain professional in speech even if you get tired since it is an interview.  (Maybe I just got tired because during the interview I learned more about the position that I wasn't too excited about).
Interview Questions: Your working with K-12 groups.  You schedule a group of middle school students to come tour the campus and listen to a speaker.  The speaker is kind of boring and you notice the kids getting bored, not listening and talking; what do you do about the speaker?

title: Floor Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: A friend who worked there recommended I apply. Applied and got an interview about 10 days later. Was offered the job within a few days. Interviewed with two interviewers together, was relaxed and enjoyable. Knowing an employee helps a lot.
Interview Questions:
Are you willing to clean up vomit?

What would you do if a patron was angry about where they were sitting but refused to pay to upgrade their seat?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied for PHD and Research assistant in CSE of ASU. My mentor called me and asked for some questions from my resume.
Interview Questions: no unexpected question. Just from my CV

title: Graduate Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Looked for application info online (Writing Programs/English Department website), and submitted a letter of application and a current resume/CV. I was sent a letter to apply with my notification that I had been accepted to the PhD Program in English. I was notified by email a few weeks after submitting my application that I was accepted into the TA position, which would come with a full stipend for a tuition waiver. Awesome!! It also necessitated that I move to AZ about a month earlier than anticipated to attend a three-week intensive "boot camp" training with about 20-25 fellow new TAs.
Interview Questions: What is your previous teaching experience?

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Most interviews now start with phone interviews and some are via Skype. Many All interviews are panel interviews. Be prepared to talk about experience in higher education and respond to behavioral based questions. Come prepared to know about the department AND ASU as a whole pertaining the New American University.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you dealt with conflict with a co-worker.

title: Production Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I received a letter notifying me that I was selected to interview for the position. I had an interview with a group of 5 people of various ages and responsibilities, after which I was escorted to a one-on-one interview with the Creative Director. I had a very positive interview and was given very positive feedback. I was asked to complete a simple test and passed with flying colors. I was provided excellent feedback after the interview and the final selection, even though I was not selected.
Interview Questions: What did your last interview say to you?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Behavior questions and asked about your research background. First it was a one-on-one phone call from the program chair, then it was follow by an on-site interview. The job offer came after 1 months of the on-site interview. Overall, the experience was great.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go to graduate school? What drives your passion for research?

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty smooth and efficient. I knew I was a good fit for the position and the interviewer also knew that. It lasted about half an hour and I got the job offer in couple days.
Interview Questions: How do I fit to the position?

title: Management Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to the position on referral from an existing employee regarding the position and applied for it through the ASU Careers website. I got a mail regarding the reciept of my application immediately and after about 2 weeks I was contacted by the HR regarding scheduling a 1:1 interview with a Sr. Manager. I was interviewed by a panel of 3, consisting of 1 HR Personnel, the senior manager and another Management Intern. The interview basically consisted of all HR questions like:
- How would you handle a conflict.
- How comfortable are you when it comes to working in a team.
- Do you any experience in training and mentoring.
Interview Questions: Have you ever faced a situation involving ethics?

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was good, professor ask about my interest in the filed, why do i want to a do a PhD in bioinformatics etc, my btech was in CS, so mainly he was more interested in knowing why am i changing the field. Then he asked me if i had any questions, i just asked him about his latest projects , grants and type of work they are doing.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: it was easy, but I have to do a presentation about my previous research work. The phone interview was about describing my future work as a postdoc
Interview Questions: why new york university

title: Systems Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Your resume goes through a scoring process, the more key terms you match your resume with the posting the higher your ranked. Make sure you submit a complete application, if it ask for something submit it, or you will be dropped.  I had one in person interview about a month after submitting my app.  About three weeks after that I was offered a position.
Interview Questions: It was a couple years ago, nothing super difficult.  It was for an IT job so questions mostly related to the position and a few customer service questions.

title: Instructional Technology Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: A very lengthy process;  one may not hear back for an initial phone interview for two months, and after the phone interview the process still moves slowly.  Interview committee was made up of university staff and professors, and the questions were more informal and behavioral than corporate and cut-and-dry. Phone interview generally consists of a conference call with 3 other individuals, representing interested parties in the position itself.  As it is an educational institution, interviewees should be prepared to answer questions about their views on undergraduate education and the like.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you built something.

title: Assistant Professor - CLAS Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Typical application for academic positions - writing sample / article, CV, cover letter, teaching statement. INterivew was one research presentation to the department faculty. Meetings with Dean, Research center head, Chair / Assistant Chair, and panel interview with hiring committee. There were "office hours" to meet with faculty as they dropped in. Meeting rooms and faculty offices were pretty sad really. Furniture was nice in the offices but spaces small, technology dated and building frankly tired. Faculty were energetic, hardworking and eager graduate students were a breath of fresh air with lots of activities going on.
Interview Questions: What have you heard negatively about our unit / university?

title: Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Extremely hectic schedule, 7 interviews (30 minutes, each) with renowned Faculty/Scientists. Its a good idea to read professional interests of interviewers prior to the interview day if possible so as to have interesting scientific conversations with them. Most interviewers were laid-back realizing candidates might be nervous, and were kind enough to provide a decent introduction of their areas of interest. It's always a good idea to have a couple questions ready per interviewer in advance.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to interview with me?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Denver, CO) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then phone interview, followed by in person interview. The position was out of state, and the supervisor came to me to conduct the interview
Interview Questions: I had to prepare a Power Point presentation for future students.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: submit the resume and other information online and then got an email for interview. It was a panel interview, ans each member asked a bunch of questions. If you really do not catch some questions, then ask them what they specifically asking for.
Interview Questions: What do you think need be changed for the current health system, if you have the power to do anything.

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Before the interview, we turned in a resume with the application for the position. We first had a 1:1 interview with another Community Assistant and one of the Community Directors at ASU. And then we went into a group setting and the group was surrounded by a multitude of other Community Assistants and I was watched to see how well I interact with others in a group and that I take a leadership role as well.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time that you demonstrated your ability to help a friend with a personal problem.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Please be as detailed as possible - everything from your initial communications with the company, organization and planning of the interview, number and type of interviews, and any advice you might offer to other interview candidates. Bonus points for your perceptions of the people, office, and work culture.
Interview Questions: asked me to model a data center in flovent

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: If you know someone, it is very fast an easy.  It is difficult to get an interview off the street.  Most jobs are created with someone internally in mind.
Interview Questions: Name all possible species of nitrogen off of the top of your head, and the analysis methodology you would use for each one with water as the substrate.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple and maybe 20 min interview, not much behavior questions. Only one about a simple accounting concept, which can be answered by a freshman. And only some classic questions like tell me about your self, and also what do you expect to get from this job. Anyway, although it is a school job, it is important to dress business professional, and that's why I got the offer
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Analyst/Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Responded to job notice on ASU site.  Submitted a cover letter, resume and three references.  Was called a week later to interview for position.  Was asked questions about my work experience and why I'm qualified for this position.  Was also asked to demonstrate my office skills.  It was a two-on-one interview.
Interview Questions: Why I am qualified to work at ASU.

title: Facility Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: The process is a group interview, so the key is to try and make yourself stand out from the others. The questions are very basic and personality based, so show that you'll be a nice and fun person to work with.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: Very poor interview: Negative line of questioning and vague description of job duties and department function.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult employees, customers, situations etc.  Too many of these questions. I went away thinking this office was dysfunctional and it was!!!

title: Student Worker IV Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: Was asked abt prev exprerince
Interview Questions: wat and where  r u working currently

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: Talked about basic skills and experience and talked about what the job entails.  Quite informal.  No technical questions, just examining you're work experience and made a decision based on that.
Interview Questions: Do you have an issue with 24 hour on-call?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview, dinner with executives, a large-group interview, two small-group interviews, and finally an informal lunch.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: It is different for each department but it usually takes at least a month. The interview process is long and drags out because there's a ton of rules that they "have" to follow. When it comes down to it, if they want to hire you, they will find a way to make it happen-following the rules or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Arizona State University (Tempe, AZ) in Oct 2007
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call to come in to interview about a week after submitting my resume.  Came for the interview and it was a group interview with all the managers and the director (about 6 people).  I believe there were a few openings in the department so they all asked questions about my experience in the areas that were available.  Got a call a few days later of their decision and was asked to come in again to sign employment papers which included salary acceptance.  The pay is below average but the benefits are great.
Interview Questions: N/A
